details.title: Tracking with distributed sets of proximity sensors using geometric invariants
details.abstract: We propose a new approach to forming an estimate of a target track in a distributed sensor system using very limited sensor information. This approach uses a central fusion system that collects only the peak energy information from each sensor and assumes that the energy attenuates as a power law in range from the source. A geometrical invariance property of the proximity of the distributed sensors relative to a target track is used to generate potential target track paths. Numerical simulation examples are presented to illustrate the practicality of the technique.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
